chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Terry A. Drover was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full - bond previously posted has been applied.
Defendant to comply with any and all mental health treatment as prescribed by treating mental health care professionals.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges and Good Time Credit. Pursuant to s. 346.65(7), Wis. Stats., Defendant shall be required to remain in the County Jail for not less than a 48 consecutive hour period prior to release for huber. Sentence to commence forthwith.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

14CF11 & 14CF193 Cases called @ 1:48 p.m. Defendant Terry A. Drover in court with attorney Rebecca C. Castonia.  Defendant Terry A. Drover in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Global agreement recited by DA Blader. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing in 14CF193. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed by DA Blader. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:14CF11: Ct 1- NC. 14CF193: Cts 2 & 3 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 14CF11: Ct 2 - Dismissed outright. Ct 3 - DRI. 14CF193: Cts 1 & 4 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Castonia. Statement by DE. Court orders: 14CF11 - S/W 3 years probation - Conditions: 12 mos WCJ - Huber, GT, 97 days CFTS - Sentence to commence forthwith, $1500 fine inclusive of costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, 36 month DL rev/36 month IID effective today, OWI Assessment, defendant to comply with any and all treatment prescribed by the defendant's treating mental health care professionals, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, AODA and follow through. Bond previously posted to be applied. 
14CF193 - Ct 2 -  1 year WCJ consecutive to any other sentence currently being served - Huber, GT, 52 days CFTS - I/S - 3 years probation: Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, defendant to comply with any and all treatment prescribed by the defendant's treating mental health care professionalsCosts w/ 60 DTP or PP. Ct 2 - 90 days WCJ - Huber, GT - Concurrent with 14CF11, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.

Case Called @ 1:28 PM: Defendant Terry A. Drover in court with attorney Rebecca C. Castonia.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA requests Court address s. 906.09 motion.  Statement by Atty Castonia as to impeachment.  No dispute as to prior convictions - totaling 11 in number.  Def confirms number of previous offenses.  The Court:  Finds that should Def testify at trial, State may inquire of Def if he has ever been convicted of a crime and number of previous convictions, 11 total offenses.  Evidence to be admitted upon Def's testimony.  As to Old Chief Stipulated:  Atty Castonia confirms Def believes the abstract is accurate.  Requests to review OAR with Def prior to stipulating.  Old Chief and Wallerman/Dekeyser Stip to be addressed just prior to trial.  DA argues as to Def's MIL's filed via fax earlier today - State objects as to Paras 3, 4, 5 and 6.  Atty Castonia requests proper jury instruction be given as to familiarity.  Any law enforcement witness testifying as to familiarity with Def that witness will be able to testify as to how familiarity occurred and basis for familiarity.  Limited reference as to familiarity with Def by said witnesses who will testify.  As far as case in chief, Court concurs that any treatment conditions would not be germane.  Different scenario however, should any issues be brought forth by Def during testimony. Court's intent is that any witnesses testifying as to familiarity will be based upon said witness' prior contact with Defendant.  Tele STC scheduled to allow counsel to confirm with the court if resolution reached or trial will proceed.
Status conference on September 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.

from Attorney Zamzow Re: Funeral Arrangements for Defendant's Brother
Preliminary hearing on February 28, 2014 at 03:45 pm.

Case Called @ 2:11 PM: Defendant Terry A. Drover in court with attorney Jeanne Zamzow.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Atty Zamzow argues for amendment of cash bond - modified to $1500 cash, Def has those funds available to post the lesser cash.  Def's brother has just passed away w/in the last few days and services expected to be later this week.  ADA argues for previously ordered bond to remain in place - $2500 appropriate based upon offense number.  Would leave any further amendment up to the Court's discretion.  The Court:  Will leave the previously ordered bond as is of $2500 cash.  The Court:  Release authorized from the jail to attend the funeral services from a time 2 hrs before the beginning of the service until a time 2 hrs after the conclusion of the funeral services.  Def to be allowed to spend time with family members.  Court will expect strict adherence to this time frame. Atty Zamzow to make the jail staff aware of the funeral arrangements.  Some other party will have to transport Def to the sevices.  Pre-Lim Scheduled - NOH Given.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2014 at 03:45 pm.
Initial appearance on February 18, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is prohibited from going on the premises of any bars.  No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.

Case Called @ 12:45 PM: Defendant Terry A. Drover in court, in custody, appearing via video.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Arrangements already in place for a Dean Appointment with for Jeanne Zamzow.   ADA argues for cash bond in light of significant offense number - $2500 cash bond requested.  Statement as to bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
